data.text:
Hello:

When creating layered MIDI drum tracks from the Producer Kits, the only snare tracks created by default seem to be Snare Top and Snare Bottom. That said, I notice more options in the "Overhead" layer (snare center, rimshot etc.) which is great in allowing more human-sounding drums (I think?).

That said, I'm curious if it's possible to create a SEPARATE LAYER/TRACK for just the "snare center" etc, as with toms, kick in/kick out, etc. I see these options with the "overheads" track, but nothing with the Snare top or bottom? Okay let me know if YOU know

cheers

chef

Snare top and Snare bottom are the two microphones that were used to record the snare drum: one on top, the other on the bottom, and consequently the two channel strips in the Mixer and two corresponding tracks where the sound from those two microphones is routed and can be mixed together.

What you're seeing in the Piano Roll (snare center, rimshot etc.) are called "articulations", meaning they correspond to different ways for the drummer to hit the snare, so you can trigger those different recordings (samples) by using the corresponding different MIDI Note pitches.

Hope that makes sense?

Yeah David makes sense and thanks for the quick reply. I do know about the "snare top/bottom" (just like recording a real kit), but in my never-ending quest to make the drums sound more human (especially the snare with a zydeco/cajun feel), I'm very interested in spreading the hits around a bit with more than just snare top/bottom (if that makes sense).

So I guess I'd love more info on how to add the "corresponding MIDI note pitches" with a touch pad or keyboard?
